modules.description: Provides functions for creating and managing DNS client contexts, establishing connections, sending and receiving DNS messages, and handling I/O operations with non-blocking I/O. Works with types like `context`, `io_addr`, `stack`, and `t` to enable asynchronous network communication. Used to configure DNS resolution, manage timeouts, and perform low-level socket operations in networked applications.

Processes DNS queries and constructs responses using strict protocol adherence. Operates on packet buffers, domain names, and resource records. Enables implementation of DNS resolvers and authoritative servers for custom zones and network diagnostics.

manages DNS client operations with asynchronous I/O using types such as `context`, `io_addr`, `stack`, and `t` to handle network communication. It supports creating client contexts, sending and receiving DNS messages, and managing timeouts and socket operations. Functions enable configuring DNS resolution and performing non-blocking network interactions. Examples include resolving domain names, setting custom timeouts, and handling DNS queries asynchronously.
